org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables

Annotation Type Check


  • @Repeatable
 @Target
 @Retention
public Check

    Methods annotated with this annotation will be treated as expectation checks of a annotationclass DecisionTableFixture.

    The expectation value will be taken from the column matching one of the org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Check$value() mappings. All checks will be executed after all annotationclass Input annotated methods were invoked.

    Annotated methods have to have exactly one parameter. If this parameter is of one of the natively supported types, it will be set using one of LivingDoc's interface TypeConverter implementations. If you want to use your own, or the type is not natively supported, you wil have to configure a interface TypeConverter either directly on the method or on the fixture class using the annotationclass Converter annotation.

    The annotation can have multiple org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Check$value(). One usecase for this might be having multiple languages for your documentation or having changed the column name between versions of your documentation you still want to maintain.

    See Also:
    annotationclass DecisionTableFixture, org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Check$value(), annotationclass Input, interface TypeConverter, interface TypeConverter, annotationclass Converter, org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Check$value(), annotationclass DecisionTableFixture, annotationclass Input, annotationclass Converter, interface TypeConverter
